body.p:
i received your letter yesterday with the 5 dl dollars and it was very acceptable well walt there is so much to write about really i dont don't know how to begin well to commence george is getting along pretty well but very little upsets him he has the headach headache and is not very strong but he goes down town almost every day but gets tired toward night but i think he will get along very well)
now i must tell you walt how we are getting along with our troubles matty has sold nearly all her things except her carpets and beds and spent the money as fast as it came in for clothes to go in the country for many things she got more than she gave for her chickins chickens she got 18 dls dollars and all she sold yery very well mr bullard owes her 100) hundred which mrs Beecher is responcible responsible for and the house is all in confusion and a dresmaker dressmaker here till saturday Saturday and they are here cleaning and to morrow tomorrow mat and the children and dresmakere dressmaker moves up with me george says i must try to

have patience but I dont don't know how i can stand it very long never was any thing managed so before her going off to masons to stay is so absurd and we must move O walt if they was away i should get a place and move but i dont don't know how to get a place for them all she sold all her things and boxed up all her beds and matt has had so much money to spend but then i wont won't say any more the bullards is coming next tuesday Tuesday davis has got back from worsterWorcester mat says he wants me to get out and not be hanging on) they want to hire the piano he is having the house all put in thourough thorough order at the park expenceexpense)

well Walt i am done with that part now i must tell you the other side George is not going to put a house on the putman Putnam aven avenue lot but will sell it for what it will fetch back of the blacksmiths shop they have put a carpenters shop so he and smith went to look at it the other day and decided not to build on it at all
he and smith went to look at some lots yesterday they liked very much on the corner of tomkins Tompkins avenu avenue and lafaette Lafayette st
george says it is very fine but it is a plot and the price is 3000 dollar dollars cash the turners has the selling of it he has gone again to day to see what they can doo do george says he knows you would like it it is within one block of the decalb DeKalb ave cars if they could get it they would build a number of smalish smallish houses he says the neigberhood neighborhood is very good but he is afraid they cant can't manage to get it so when i next write i dont don't know what the progress will be but Walt you must not be alarmed if you hear we have bough bought the lickfield litchfield property or maybee maybe some of the shantys shanties on the park i often think if i had a shanty i could be contented where i could be at peace and not have to move

postscript.p: i will try to take things coolly as you advise
i will write when we get a place i thought we would get a second story there seems to be quite a number to rent
